notes:
We did not use search filters designed to retrieve diagnostic test accuracy studies (collections of terms aimed at reducing the number needed to screen by filtering out irrelevant records and retaining only those that are relevant) as a method to restrict the search overall, because available filters have not yet proved sensitive enough for systematic review searches (Beynon 2013; Whiting 2011). We did not apply any language restriction

Note that though then say from 1946, in the query strategy for MEDLINE they say 1950-present.
They also report hit restrictions:
Nov 2012: 10048
May 2014: 1657

This review used the "Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials" and most pubmed references may have come from there - they also do pubmed searches; but because of the Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials, it may be an issue to correctly align search results. It is unclear how they combined the search terms:
"sing the following search terms: c(a)esarean section; tocolysis; betamimetics; glyceryl tri-nitrate; calcium channel blockers; birth injury; and birth trauma."

They focus on randomised controlled trials. Also, "We excluded quasi-randomised trials (e.g. those randomised by date of birth or hospital number) from the analysis."
